extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipes.title: Mac and Cheese Soufflé with Country Ham from Sweet Potatoes Restaurant

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. You could try Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Cleto Chiarli Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Amabile
productMatches.description: A semi-sweet wine of an intense red color. The wine has very fruity aromas and all the grape fragrances can be felt. Lively and fading bubbles are of a marked rose color. Its smoothness makes it surprisingly pleasant, though avoiding excesses. A captivating wine.Apart form being an good companion for traditional cuisinefrom Emilia, it is also indicated as an accompaniment to desserts.

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 2-quart soufflé dish. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the pasta until it is just beginning to soften to the al dente stage. Drain the pasta, and return it to the pot.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Reserve 1/2 cup of the cheddar. Stir the remaining cheddar, blue cheese, and Parmesan into the hot pasta. Combine the eggs, sour cream, cream, and dill in a bowl, and whisk well. Add it to the macaroni mixture. Stir well.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Heat the bacon grease in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ham, and cook for 2 minutes, or until heated through. Stir the ham into the pasta, and pour it into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the reserved cheddar on top.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Bake the soufflé in the center of the oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the custard is set. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 2-quart soufflé dish. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the pasta until it is just beginning to soften to the al dente stage.
Drain the pasta, and return it to the pot.
Reserve 1/2 cup of the cheddar. Stir the remaining cheddar, blue cheese, and Parmesan into the hot pasta.
Combine the eggs, sour cream, cream, and dill in a bowl, and whisk well.
Add it to the macaroni mixture. Stir well.
Heat the bacon grease in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the ham, and cook for 2 minutes, or until heated through. Stir the ham into the pasta, and pour it into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the reserved cheddar on top.
Bake the soufflé in the center of the oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the custard is set.
